title: Cash row: Mumbai lawyers body writes to CJI, seeks prosecution of Justice Yashwant Varma
content: Bombay Lawyers Association sought the sanction to prosecute Justice Yashwant Varma, besides referring to the Supreme Court rejecting a PIL on the issue on May 21

title: Jammu & Kashmir Police asks Anantnag residents not to use VPNs
content: VPNs have the potential to be misused for unlawful and anti-national activities, including inciting unrest and disseminating inflammatory content, said officials

title: Ensure better coordination with State enforcement agencies, nab masterminds: Sitharaman to DRI officers
content: Inaugurating the new headquarters building of the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence, Nirmala Sitharaman said that narcotics is the biggest threat as it is coming into every State and even small towns

title: Will work with Forest Department of Karnataka for wildlife conservation, says cricketer Anil Kumble
content: The cricketer said that his earlier experience of serving as vice-president of the Karnataka Wildlife Board would help him in his new role

title: J&K L-G sacks three govt. employees day after Mehbooba’s plea for political initiatives
content: Security agencies accuse the terminated employees of having links with the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and Hizbul Mujahideen

title: Pakistan wants to bleed India by thousand cuts, we drew new redlines to combat terror: Gen Chauhan
content: Gen Chauhan also made a mention about Pakistan Army chief Gen Asim Munir "spewing venom" against India and Hindus just weeks before the Pahalgam attack

title: Dental clinic that led to death of eight patients in Tamil Nadu’s Vaniyambadi shut down
content: Unsterile surgical instrument was used to open a saline bottle at the clinic. Reuse of the bottle’s contents had led to at least 10 people contracting neuromelioidosis — a bacterial infection of the brain — which allegedly led to the death of eight patients in 2023, says a study.

title: Thug Life: Apology does not make anyone smaller, arrogance will not make anyone greater, says B.S. Yediyurappa Kamal Haasan
content: Actor-politician Kama Haasan’s claim that ‘Kannada was born out of Tamil’ during a promotional event for Thug Life sparked widespread outrage among pro-Kannada groups and cultural organisations

title: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister criticises Rahul for not taking off his shoes while paying tribute to Indira Gandhi
content: “He offered floral tribute to his Dadi ji [grandmother] and did not remove his shoes. This did not suit me. This is against our sanskar [culture],“ Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav

title: After Indus Waters Treaty abeyance, Pakistan floating threat narrative of 'what if China stops Brahmaputra flow': Himanta
content: The Assam Chief Minister said that even if China were to 'reduce water flow, which is unlikely, it may actually help India mitigate the annual floods in Assam

title: Chaotic scenes at new Assam Congress chief's felicitation
content: Gaurav  Gogoi took over as the new party chief from outgoing president Bhupen Kumar Borah at the party's State headquarters Rajiv Bhawan earlier in the day

title: Rahul Gandhi visits Madhya Pradesh, holds meeting with senior Congress leaders
content: M.P. Congress president Jitu Patwari and former Chief Minister Kamal Nath accorded a warm welcome to Rahul Gandhi as he arrived at the airport in Bhopal

title: Calcutta High Court grants bail to murder accused citing Article 21 of Constitution over trial delay
content: Justice Ghosh noted that the petitioners approached the court with a prayer for bail for the first time after being incarcerated for more than 12 years

title: Arunachal Pradesh flood toll rises to 11 as labourer dies in wall collapse, 938 affected in 23 districts
content: Widespread destruction has been reported in the Itanagar Capital Region (ICR) and Pakke Kessang, where key assets such as ICR's main water pipeline and the road at Dariya Hill have been severely affected

title: India can engage in dialogue with Pakistan if it takes significant action against terror infrastructure that is visible everywhere: Tharoor
content: "They want to cut us this whole bleeding to death India by 1,000 cuts. They're not going to bleed to death so easily. Better forget that idea," said Mr. Tharoor in a recent statement

title: Environmentalists of Tunga Bhadra Abhiyan urge government of Karnataka to avoid pollution of rivers
content: L.K. Sreepathi, a retired professor of an engineering college, stated that tests on water samples revealed that the level of aluminium was as high as six times the permissible limit

title: Calcutta HC directs state to produce case diary in Panoli arrest, posts bail prayer hearing on June 5
content: Justice Mukherjee observed that one must be careful in making comments in public in a diverse country like India.

title: Body of Tanzanian national who went missing in Kochi backwaters found
content: Abdul Ibrahim Salih, 22, who was undergoing training at Indian Naval Academy at Ezhimala, went missing on Sunday

title: Ban on movement of Kukis in Naga areas suspended
content: The restriction from June 2 was in response to an attack on Konsaram, a Liangmai Naga village in the Kangpokpi district, on April 5

content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru is looking to break a 17-year-old jinx and script victory at the IPL 2025 finals, being played at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

title: Assam group claims victory after ADB cancels loan for solar project
content: The Asian Development Bank said the Ministry of Finance requested the withdrawal of the $434.25 million loan approved in October 2024

title: Madras High Court upholds night ban on online real money games in Tamil Nadu
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and K. Rajasekar dismiss all writ petitions filed by online gaming companies

content: INDIA bloc MPs have signed a letter addressed to the Prime Minister raising the demand for a special session of Parliament, opposition leaders said

title: Kamal Haasan on Kannada remark: My words were intended only to convey we are all from same family
content: “I really regret that Shivanna (Kannada actor Shiva Rajkumar) had to go through such embarrassment on account of this,” stated Kamal Haasan

title: Anna University sexual assault case: Annamalai warns of revealing identities of police officers allegedly contacted by convict
content: Several questions about Anna University sexual assault case remain unanswered, Mr. Annamalai charged.

title: Hema Committee report: No headway in probes; police decide to drop cases as survivors stay silent
content: However, investigations into around 70 cases registered based on disclosures made after Hema Committee report’s release are under way

title: Kamal Haasan won’t release ‘Thug Life’ in Karnataka on June 5, chooses not to apologise for his controversial remark on Kannada
content: When Chakravarthi Rajagopalchari in 1950s had apologised for saying Kannada is evolved from Tamil, why can’t Haasan, the Court had asked earlier

title: Arunachal orders closure of 386 government schools for zero enrolment
content: The closure affect schools in almost every district, including remote and border regions such as Kurung Kumey, Tawang, Anjaw, Changlang and Upper Subansiri

title: Nilambur bypoll: P.V. Anvar to contest as independent after EC rejects Trinamool nomination
content: Election Commission rejects his nomination as Trinamool Congress candidate on technical grounds during scrutiny. But the commission accepts his second set of nomination as independent candidate

title: Museum of Art & Photography installations to be exhibited at Terminal 2 of Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru
content: The Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) which operates KIA, stated that this collaboration aims to transform the airport into a dynamic cultural hub

title: Parvathy Thiruvothu slams Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan over inaction on Hema Committee report
content: Her remarks came after it was reported that the police plan to close the remaining cases registered on the basis of statements recorded in the committee’s findings

title: Man held in Punjab for sharing sensitive information with Pakistan
content: Investigations said the accused was engaged in sharing classified details, including troop deployments and strategic locations, posing a threat to national security.

title: Angels’ World is a community living project in Thiruvananthapuram built by parents of neurodivergent children
content: Angels’ World at Mannanthala in Thiruvananthapuram has been set up by 10 sets of parents who have children on the autism spectrum

title: Over 56,000 people affected, 10,477 houses damaged in Manipur floods
content: Several localities in the State's capital Imphal, and many parts of Imphal East district have been inundated after a swollen river breached embankments and overflowed in Khurai, Heingang and Checkon areas

title: 17-year-old goes missing from Piravom in Kerala
content: The boy had gone to school in the morning when the new academic year began. However, he did not  return, and his parents lodged a police complaint.

title: MHA notifies new policies for Union Territory of Ladakh that determine domicile tag
content: The policies are introduced to provide 85% of reservation for the Scheduled Tribes (ST) in government jobs

title: How is President’s Rule imposed? | Explained
content: What does Article 356 of the Constitution stipulate? How have different Governors dealt with dissolving Legislative Assemblies after President’s Rule has been invoked? When did the Supreme Court first intervene in the decision of the Union Government to impose President’s Rule?

title: News Analysis: Ahead of polls, all eyes in Bihar on Chirag Paswan’s next political move
content: The LJP(RV) chief and party MP has said he does not see himself in national politics for long; the statements from him and his party have generated considerable interest, amid buzz that the could play a bigger role in State politics in the future

title: Ennore: Where industrial growth has made life difficult for residents
content: Residents of Ennore struggle with pollution on a day-to-day basis, but it gains widespread attention only when a major incident occurs

title: Home Minister’s remarks on West Bengal CM opposing Operation Sindoor incorrect and motivated, says TMC
content: On June 1, the Home Minister Amit Shah had accused the Trinamool Congress chairperson of opposing “Operation Sindoor” to “appease the Muslim vote bank”. In a statement the TMC said that “the CM has consistently backed national security initiatives, including Operation Sindoor”

title: Telangana govt. to develop 80-acres Eco-Town modelled on Japanese city Kitakyushu
content: The State government of Telangana will also be collaborating with Kitakyushu on several forward-looking initiatives

title: Under pressure on the battlefield, Ukraine turns to drones to hurt Russia
content: Ukraine claimed its Sunday attacks destroyed over 40 Russian warplanes, including nuclear-capable bombers; Russia says the strikes were repelled with no casualties; the attack was in the works for 18 months, says Kyiv; the strike came as both sides were preparing for peace talks in Istanbul

title: Officers close to Jharkhand CM conspiring against me, alleges BJP leader Babulal Marandi
content: JMM hit back at Mr. Marandi, saying he has made a baseless allegation for petty politics; party spokesperson Tanuj Khatri says under the visionary leadership of Hemant Soren, Jharkhand has entered a new phase of inclusive development

title: BJP takes dig at Congress ahead of Rahul Gandhi’s visit to Haryana
content: The Congress in Haryana is yet to choose its Legislature Party leader (CLP), who would serve as the Leader of Opposition in the Assembly, though it has been eight months since the new govt. was formed in the State

title: New Uttar Pradesh DGP outlines blueprint to improve policing
content: The 1991-batch Indian Police Service (IPS) officer expressed gratitude to U.P. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath for trusting him to lead the world’s largest “provincial police force

content: Russia also hinted at expanding bilateral cooperation with India in air defence and anti-drone systems

title: SRMIST and The Hindu to organise webinar on emerging careers

title: Devdutta Majhi from West Bengal’s Katwa secures top rank among girls in JEE (Advanced)
content: She has secured a top rank in JEE (Mains) this year, while also featuring among the Statewide top ten merit lists in the class 10 and class 12 board examinations

title: Pahalgam attack casts shadow on turnoutat Kheer Bhawani
content: With a sense of fear looming large this year post-Pahalgam attack and the four-day military confrontation between India and Pakistan, local politicians have come forward to encourage Pandits to visit the Valley temples.

title: Punjab approves new land pooling policy; Akali Dal terms it anti-farmer
content: Complete authority lies with the farmer, and it will be their decision whether to give land to the government or not; farmers can either keep their land and continue farming or choose to sell; there will be no forced acquisition

title: NHRC issues notice to Bihar government over death of minor rape victim at govt. hospital
content: It is alleged that the critically injured nine-year-old remained in an ambulance for several hours for want of bed

title: Rahul Gandhi approaches Jharkhand High Court challenging a non-bailable warrant
content: The case is related to Mr. Gandhi’s speech against Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders in March 2018

title: For most residents of Pakistan Tola in Bihar, the village name is an embarrassment
content: Ever since the Pahalgam attacks in April this year, people of Pakistan Tola in Bihar’s Purnia district have been demanding to change the name of the village they have been living in for years

title: Adani says it doesn't handle Iranian cargo, unaware of any U.S. probe into Iran sanctions violations
content: It went on to state that the Adani group "does not manage or facilitate any ships whose owners are Iranian. This policy is strictly adhered to across all our ports".

title: Hoardings that pose a threat to public safety yet to be removed

content: They were welcomed by teachers, accompanied by a band; 25 high school and 11 higher secondary teachers honoured on the occasion

content: The CHOs have been on a strike for more than a month demanding payment of pending incentives, an increase in their pay of ₹25,000, regularisation of services of those who completed six years and resumption of PF

title: Finals-bound TTU 'left a legacy' in ending OU reign
content: Oklahoma's run of four straight Women's College World Series titles ended when Lauren Allred's walk-off sacrifice fly gave Texas Tech a 3-2 victory in the semifinals Monday night.

title: Sources: Yankees closer Weaver out 4-6 weeks
content: New York Yankees closer Luke Weaver is expected to miss at least four weeks because of a hamstring injury, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan on Monday.

title: Trout adds to hot return, hits 454-foot HR in win
content: Trout had three more hits on Monday night, including a 454-foot homer that was the longest at Fenway Park this year, in the Angels' 7-6 victory over the Red Sox.

title: Young rallies to clinch U.S. Open spot in playoff
content: Cameron Young birdied three of his last four holes Monday to get into a 5-for-1 playoff and then made a 12-foot birdie to earn his spot in the U.S. Open.

content: Manchester United believe Bruno Fernandes is set to stay at the club this summer despite interest from Al Hilal, sources have told ESPN.

title: Tigers' Carpenter has 'special' 3-HR night in rout
content: Detroit Tigers designated hitter Kerry Carpenter smashed three home runs against the White Sox on Monday night, becoming the first Tiger to accomplish that feat since Victor Martinez in 2016.

title: Homa lugs own bag, falls short of U.S. Open spot
content: Max Homa stood out more than usual Monday in a U.S. Open qualifier filled with PGA Tour players. He was the only one carrying his own bag.

content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

content: Andreas Hale shares his thoughts on what should be next for both fighters after sharing the same boxing card on Saturday.

title: Has Verstappen's Spanish GP tantrum cost him F1 title shot?
content: Max Verstappen is already on the back foot in the F1 title fight. His Spain outburst didn't help his cause.

title: Waiver wire: Add Royals' Caglianone for power potential
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft outlines who should be claimed off the waiver wire, including potential slugger Jac Caglianone, and who should be dropped from fantasy rosters.

title: Source: Chelsea to send Sancho back to Man Utd
content: Jadon Sancho is set to return to Manchester United after Chelsea failed to agree personal terms on a permanent deal, a source has told ESPN.

title: Sources: England train in tents to mimic U.S. heat
content: England have begun training in specially-heated tents to replicate conditions at next summer's World Cup finals, sources have told ESPN.

title: Messi a factor as Rodríguez weighs club future
content: Club América's Brian Rodríguez admitted that the possibility of featuring alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suárez at Inter Miami CF plays a role in his decision-making process as he considers a move away from the Liga MX team.

title: UK threatens to sue Abramovich over Chelsea sale
content: Britain has threatened to take Russian businessman Roman Abramovich to court over the frozen £2.5 billion ($3.4bn) in proceeds from his sale of Chelsea soccer club that he wanted to go to victims of Russia's war in Ukraine.

title: 2nd-tier Roots hire ex-U.S. star Feilhaber as coach
content: Former U.S. national team midfielder Benny Feilhaber was hired Monday as coach of the Oakland Roots of the United Soccer League's second-tier Championship.

title: Messi back with Argentina after 7-month layoff
content: Argentina captain Lionel Messi has rejoined the national team for training on Monday after a seven-month break ahead of their upcoming Conmebol World Cup qualifying matches.

title: Source: USWNT's Albert leaving PSG for Lyonnes
content: United States midfielder Korbin Albert has agreed to terms to join eight-time European champions OL Lyonnes on a free transfer, a source with knowledge of the deal confirmed to ESPN.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Messi, Suárez help Miami surge up the list
content: With nine goals in two games, it's official: Inter Miami are back! Just how far have Messi & Co. jumped up ESPN's MLS Power Rankings?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Inter to offer Højlund an escape from Man United
content: Rasmus Højlund looks set to leave Man United, with Inter Milan keen to bring the striker back to Serie A. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Losses are not important, outcomes are': CDS Chauhan on Op Sindoor 'setbacks'
content: CDS General Anil Chauhan emphasised the resilience of professional military forces, stating that setbacks don't diminish their effectiveness, days after acknowledging fighter jet losses during Operation Sindoor. He highlighted adaptability and learning from mistakes as crucial. Chauhan asserted that Pakistan shouldn't hold India hostage to terrorism, referencing the Pahalgam attack's brutality and India's history as a major terror victim.

title: Kamal Haasan’s movie 'Thug Life' release deferred in Karnataka
content: The Karnataka High Court adjourned the hearing on 'Thug Life' film ban, prompted by Kamal Haasan's remarks about the Kannada language's origin. The court questioned Haasan's refusal to apologize, drawing parallels to C. Rajagopalachari's past apology.

title: Gas cylinder catches fire near Narendra Modi Stadium hours before IPL final
content: A gas cylinder ignited outside a shop near Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Tuesday morning, just hours before the IPL 2025 final match. Local residents and the fire brigade responded swiftly, extinguishing the flames and preventing any injuries. Authorities are investigating the cause of the fire, which raised safety concerns given the large crowd expected for the evening's event.

title: Mann sparks row with 'one nation, one husband' remark; BJP terms it 'vulgar'
content: The BJP has strongly criticized Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's remarks regarding Operation Sindoor, labeling them as disgraceful and vulgar. Mann questioned the BJP's Sindoor distribution initiative, leading to accusations of insulting the symbol of love and sacrifice for Indian women.

title: Anand Mahindra on Carlsen’s reaction after losing to D Gukesh: ‘Wasn’t just a…’
content: D Gukesh, the youngest World Chess Champion, defeated Magnus Carlsen at the Norway Chess tournament, earning praise from Anand Mahindra. Gukesh's composed victory contrasted with Carlsen's frustration, marking a milestone in his career with his first classical win against the world champion. He now stands third in the tournament, closely trailing Carlsen and Caruana.

title: 'Wait has been long enough': Robin Uthappa sends emotional message to RCB
content: Ahead of the Indian Premier League 2025 final clash between Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings, former RCB player Robin Uthappa has passionately voiced his support for his former team. In a video message, Uthappa acknowledged both teams' impressive journeys but expressed his strong desire to see RCB lift the trophy.

title: Tanker overturns on Varanasi–Lucknow highway; video shows villagers looting oil
content: A road accident in Amethi turned into a looting spree. A tanker overturned on the Varanasi-Lucknow highway. Instead of helping the injured driver, villagers stole the spilled refined oil. They used cans and buckets to collect the oil. Police intervened to disperse the crowd and take the driver to the hospital. The incident sparked debate about apathy and desperation.

title: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis: If I were a student right now, I would study ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: Exclusive | Rishi Sunak rooting for RCB in IPL final: 'Cheered them from Downing Street'
content: Former British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has declared his support for Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in the IPL final against Punjab Kings, citing strong family ties to Bengaluru. Sunak revealed he received an RCB jersey as a wedding gift and has been an avid follower ever since, even cheering them on at Downing Street.

title: 'RRR' got 'SMS' to put nation before party, family: BJP mocks Congress
content: Shehzad Poonawalla, BJP spokesperson, targeted Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi, Revanth Reddy, and Jairam Ramesh. He called them 'RRR'. Poonawalla accused them of echoing Pakistan's views on Operation Sindoor. He cited criticism from Congress members Shashi Tharoor, Manish Tewari, and Salman Khurshid. These members are part of diplomatic outreach. Poonawalla urged 'RRR' to prioritize the nation over party interests.

title: Why Tata Motors didn’t rebrand ‘Harrier’ EV: Company eyes 50% EV share
content: Tata Passenger Electric Mobility has launched the Harrier EV, expanding its EV lineup to six models. The Harrier EV targets tech-savvy professionals seeking enhanced performance and premium features in the growing large SUV segment. It boasts 500 Nm of torque, all-wheel drive, and advanced technology like a Samsung Neo QLED screen, aiming for a 50% EV market share.

title: Microsoft's second biggest layoffs continue: These roles likely impacted
content: Microsoft has recently eliminated over hundreds of additional jobs, following a reduction of 6,000 positions last month. These cuts are part of ongoing organizational changes aimed at positioning the company for success in a dynamic marketplace. The restructuring coincides with Microsoft's significant investment in artificial intelligence infrastructure, mirroring industry-wide efficiency initiatives.

title: Over 56,000 people affected, 10,477 houses damaged in Manipur floods
content: Manipur is grappling with severe flash floods affecting over 56,000 people, triggered by overflowing rivers and breached embankments. Thousands of homes have been damaged, and nearly 3,000 residents evacuated, primarily from Imphal East. A person is missing after being swept away by a river.

title: Indian YouTuber causes uproar with vulgar remarks on Turkish woman
content: Malik SD Khan, an Indian YouTuber, sparked outrage after posting offensive videos from Turkey. He made derogatory comments about Turkish women and disrespected a shopkeeper. Turkish citizens demanded legal action, and Khan was reportedly detained. He later apologized for his actions. Social media users supported the police action, emphasizing the importance of respecting other cultures while traveling.

title: Pakistan jailbreak: Over 200 prisoners flee during earthquake evacuation in Karachi
content: In Karachi, over 100 inmates escaped from Malir prison after earthquake tremors prompted an evacuation. Prisoners attacked guards, seizing weapons and fleeing before dawn. While 78 have been recaptured, police are searching for the remaining escapees. One inmate died and three officers were injured in a shootout. Authorities are urging the escapees to surrender, warning of potential terror charges.

title: Students at Meerut university score 78 and 80 out of 70 marks
content: Chaudhary Charan Singh University (CCSU) in Meerut faced uproar after MA Home Science students received inflated marks, exceeding the maximum possible score in the Food Science practical exam. The Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) protested, demanding a probe into the grading irregularities.

title: Magnus Carlsen meltdown: Pieces fly off the board as D Gukesh shocks World No. 1
content: In a stunning upset at Norway Chess, D Gukesh defeated Magnus Carlsen for the first time in a classical game, marking a historic moment. Carlsen's blunder under time pressure led to a dramatic win for the Indian champion. Gukesh's victory is a morale-booster, placing him among the few Indians to achieve this feat against Carlsen as world No. 1.

title: 'RCB will win': Sehwag's 'reverse jinx' leaves fans in splits ahead of IPL final
content: Ahead of the highly anticipated IPL 2025 final between Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings, Virender Sehwag playfully predicts an RCB victory. Paying a reverse psychology, Sehwag humorously suggests his support often dooms a team. He hopes his backing of RCB will inadvertently favour Punjab Kings, as both teams vie for their first-ever IPL title.

title: Who is Curtis Yarvin? Meet the ‘intellectual source code’ of Trump administration
content: Curtis Yarvin, once a tech entrepreneur, now fuels the anti-democracy movement influencing Donald Trump's policies. His vision, advocating for CEO-style autocracy and dismantling democratic norms, resonates within Trump's inner circle. Yarvin's ideas, promoting elite rule and corporate governance, are shaping policies and rhetoric on the American right, potentially leading towards a post-democratic future.

title: ‘Give your best offers by…’: Trump admin pushes countries to urgently finalise trade deals
content: The Trump administration is pushing for swift trade deal conclusions, urging nations to submit optimal proposals. This urgency follows initial tariff suspensions and market reactions. While a preliminary agreement exists with Britain, the U.S. seeks comprehensive offers on tariffs, quotas, digital commerce, and economic security from partners like the EU, Japan, Vietnam, and India.

title: IPL 2025 Final, RCB vs PBKS: Will rain play spoilsport in Ahmedabad?
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings are set to battle it out in the IPL 2025 final in Ahmedabad. Both teams are vying for their first title, with Virat Kohli leading RCB's charge. The weather forecast predicts clear skies and no rain, ensuring an uninterrupted and thrilling contest for the coveted trophy.

title: 'What if China stops Brahmaputra water?': Assam CM shuts down 'Pak's scare narrative'
content: Assam's Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma refuted Pakistan's claims about China potentially weaponizing the Brahmaputra River. Sarma clarified that the Brahmaputra is primarily fed by Indian monsoon rains, with China contributing only a smaller portion of its flow. He dismissed the concerns as fear-mongering, highlighting India's dominant role in sustaining the river's volume and asserting its water sovereignty.

title: 'Ee Sala Cup Namde': Drake bets $750,000 on RCB to win IPL 2025 final
content: Drake, the Canadian rap sensation, has placed a staggering $750,000 bet on Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) to win their first IPL title against Punjab Kings. The high-stakes wager, made through Stake, could potentially earn him over $1.3 million if RCB, fueled by Virat Kohli's impressive form, secure victory in the highly anticipated final at Narendra Modi Stadium.

title: Ladakh's new domicile rules: Specific council reservations, 85% local job quota
content: The central government has introduced new reservation and domicile rules for Ladakh, reserving 85% of jobs for local residents. These rules also reserve one-third of LAHDC seats for women. This decision follows protests and negotiations, aiming to protect Ladakh's unique identity and address concerns raised after the abrogation of Article 370.

title: 'India buying arms from Russia rubbed US the wrong way, but ... ': Trump admin
content: US Commerce Secretary stated that India's shift towards purchasing US military equipment is fostering a stronger trade relationship, potentially leading to a bilateral trade agreement soon. He highlighted that India's previous reliance on Russian arms had strained ties. Both nations aim to finalize the initial phase of a trade deal by late 2025, targeting $500 billion in bilateral trade.

title: IPL match today, PBKS vs RCB: All you need to know about the final
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings are set to clash in the IPL 2025 final, both seeking a historic win. RCB aims to break their title drought, while PBKS seeks their first title since 2014. The Ahmedabad pitch favors batting, and warm, slightly muggy conditions are expected for the evening match.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 goes below 24,550; BSE Sensex tanks over 700 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, were volatile in trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 went below 24,550, BSE Sensex sank over 700 points.

title: NEET UG answer key 2025 released: Submit challenges online by this date
content: National Testing Agency has released the provisional answer key for NEET UG 2025. Candidates can download it from neet.nta.nic.in. The answer key challenge window is open from June 3 to June 5, 2025. Candidates can submit challenges online. NTA will prepare final answer keys based on these challenges. NEET UG results are expected by June 14, 2025.

title: 19-yr-old killed by ‘boyfriend’ for 'talking to another man’; stabbed over 40 times
content: A 19-year-old woman was discovered murdered in a Moradabad farm on Sunday, having been missing since Saturday evening. Police reported over 40 stab wounds on her body, indicating she was also strangled.

title: IPL Final, RCB vs PBKS: Mood in Ahmedabad completely dry ahead of title decider
content: Ahmedabad's mood ahead of the IPL 2025 final between RCB and PBKS is unexpectedly subdued, with low fan turnout and sluggish merchandise sales. Despite star power and high stakes, the city lacks buzz. Rain remains a threat but excitement lingers as fans await a new champion. Will it be Rajat Patidar’s RCB or Shreyas Iyer’s Punjab Kings?

title: Woman falls at Bengaluru auto driver’s feet to apologise after thrashing him with slippers
content: A software engineer, Pankhuri Mishra, and her husband publicly apologized to an autorickshaw driver after she assaulted him following a near-collision in Bengaluru. The incident, triggered by her concern for her pregnancy during sudden braking, led to her arrest and subsequent bail.

title: Will we get to see a Tharoor vs Bhutto? India and Pak delegations to be in US same day
content: An Indian all-party delegation, led by Shashi Tharoor, is set to visit Washington, DC, coinciding with a Pakistani delegation headed by Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari. Tharoor anticipates increased interest due to the presence of both delegations presenting opposing views on India-Pakistan relations. He is confident that the Indian delegation will effectively convey its message despite the crowded media landscape.

title: IPL 2025 final, RCB vs PBKS: A new champion will be crowned today
content: Virat Kohli's quest for an elusive IPL title with Royal Challengers Bengaluru takes center stage as they face a Shreyas Iyer-led Punjab Kings in the final. While Kohli aims to complete his trophy cabinet, PBKS seeks their maiden title. The match promises a thrilling contest between two evenly matched teams, with the team holding their nerve likely to emerge victorious.

title: 'Aap hi ko copy kiya': Khan Sir's wedding banter with Tejashwi Yadav goes viral
content: Educator Khan Sir celebrated his marriage with a grand reception in Patna, attended by prominent Bihar politicians. He revealed the wedding was a private affair due to India-Pakistan tensions, mirroring Tejashwi Yadav's secret marriage. Khan Sir shared the news with his students first, acknowledging their importance, and plans a special feast for them as a gesture of gratitude.

title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine’s drone strikes will continue until Russia halts offensive
content: President Zelenskyy affirmed Ukraine's successful drone attack on Russia, warning of continued strikes unless Moscow ceases its offensive. Speaking after US-brokered peace talks in Istanbul, he highlighted the drone strike as a strategic operation. Both sides agreed to exchange wounded prisoners and discussed a potential meeting between Zelenskyy and Putin, while Russia rejected Ukraine's ceasefire proposal.

title: 'I am very compassionate': Joni Ernst defends her 'we all are going to die' remark
content: Senator Joni Ernst defended her "we all are going to die" statement made at a heated town hall regarding a GOP-backed domestic policy bill. The bill, named the One Big Beautiful Bill act, proposes work requirements for some Medicaid recipients, sparking criticism and accusations of contempt from constituents and potential electoral challengers.

title: Rajat Patidar's captaincy saga: From self-doubt to brink of immortality
content: Rajat Patidar stands on the cusp of IPL glory, leading RCB in their quest to end an 18-year title drought against PBKS. Despite initial self-doubt, Patidar's captaincy has transformed RCB, marked by dominant performances. KKR coach Chandrakant Pandit highlights Patidar's rapid learning and mental fortitude, evident in his leadership of Madhya Pradesh and his proactive approach to improvement.

title: 'We are not looking for war': Shashi Tharoor says Brazil backs India's anti-terror stance against Pakistan
content: Shashi Tharoor, leading an all-party delegation in Brazil, conveyed India's firm stance against cross-border terrorism following the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor. Brazil expressed solidarity, condemning terrorism against Indian civilians. Tharoor emphasized India's calibrated response, seeking global understanding for its counter-terrorism strategy. The delegation engaged with Brazilian officials and the India-Brazil Friendship Front, reinforcing cooperation and addressing India's security concerns.

title: Pak spy arrested for sharing sensitive info to ISI during Op Sindoor
content: Tarn Taran Police, in collaboration with Counter-Intelligence-Punjab, arrested Gagandeep Singh for allegedly sharing sensitive information with Pakistan's ISI and Gopal Singh Chawla. He is accused of leaking classified details about army movements during Operation Sindoor, posing a national security threat. Investigations revealed a five-year connection with Chawla and Pakistani Intelligence Operatives, involving financial transactions through Indian channels.

title: Pakistan's Punjab speaker backs Pahalgam attacker at rally
content: A Pakistani Punjab assembly speaker, Malik Ahmed Khan, has sparked controversy by publicly supporting Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) deputy chief Saifullah Kasuri, a US-designated terrorist linked to the Pahalgam attack. Khan defended Kasuri at a rally, dismissing accusations pending investigation.

title: "Panda-Mania": Twin Cubs Steal The Spotlight, Spark Craze In Hong Kong
content: Move over dim sum and skyline selfies-Hong Kong's hottest new attraction is furry, adorable, and already a national treasure. The city is riding a wave of "panda-mania" with the grand public debut of its first-ever giant panda twins, making headlines

title: Supreme Court's 7 Directions For Domestic Violence Act Implementation
content: The Supreme Court has not only asked authorities to appoint protection officers to assist victims of domestic violence across the country within sixweeks, but also issued several detailed directions.

title: Passerby Jumps In To Save 3 Workers Trapped In Septic Tank, All 4 Killed
content: Three workers and a passerby who jumped in to help them have died of suffocation after inhaling toxic gases in a septic tank in Odisha.

title: Why This Bridge On Chenab Is Just What Kashmir Needs After Pahalgam Attack
content: Three days from now, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will travel to Jammu and Kashmir to inaugurate what is nothing short of an engineering marvel

title: Is AI Sparking A Cognitive Revolution That Will Lead To Mediocrity And Conformity?
content: Artificial Intelligence began as a quest to simulate the human brain. Is it now in the process of transforming the human brains role in daily life?

title: Anti-Smog Guns On High-Rises, Artificial Rain Project: Delhi's Clean Air Plan
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Tuesday launched the city's ambitious 'Air Pollution Mitigation Plan 2025', titled "Shuddh Hawa Sabka Adhikar - Pradushan Par Zordar Prahar", to combat the capital's chronic air pollution.

title: Saudi Readies For "Worst Case Scenario" In Sweltering Hajj
content: Near a sprawling tent city outside Mecca, Saudi hospital staff are preparing for a flood of heat-related cases as Muslim pilgrims begin hajj this week in sweltering summer temperatures.

title: As India, US Close In On Mega Trade Deal, A Look At Its Immediate Impact
content: India and the United States are on a cusp of an agreement that will reshape commerce between the two largest democracies in the world.

title: "Good Sign": J&K Lt Governor As Devotees Attend Mela Kheer Bhawani
content: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Tuesday described the large number of devotees attending the Kheer Bhawani Mela as a "good sign", especially in light of the recent terror attack in Pahalgam.

title: New Model Helps To Figure Out Which Distant Planets May Host Life
content: The US is building multiple major telescopes and planetary probes to advance the search for life beyond Earth.

title: "Tick It Off Bucket List": Garba By Indian Tourists In Austria Goes Viral
content: A video of a group of Indian tourists performing Garba, a traditional Gujarati folk dance, on the streets of Austria has gone viral.

title: Produce Case Dairy: High Court To Bengal Government On Influencer's Arrest
content: The Calcutta High Court on Tuesday directed the West Bengal government to produce the case diary in connection with the arrest of law student Sharmistha Panoli on June 5, when her interim bail prayer will be heard again.

title: "One Nation, One Husband?" Bhagwant Mann's Bizarre Remark On Op Sindoor
content: In a controversial remark, Punjab Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Bhagwant Mann has said that the BJP was turned "sindoor" into a joke and asked if this was a "one nation, one husband" scheme.

title: Op Sindoor: Pak Dossier Shows India Struck More Targets Than Revealed
content: India struck more Pakistan targets during Operation Sindoor than our forces acknowledged, an official dossier in Pakistan has revealed.

title: 27 Palestinians Killed Near Gaza Aid Distribution Site In Rafah
content: Israel states that it retaliated towards a group of individuals who had left designated access routes near the distribution centre in Rafah.

title: UP To Give 20% Reservation To Agniveers In Police Department
content: The Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday decided to provide 20 per cent reservation for Agniveers in direct recruitment to several positions in the state police force

title: Assad Regime Detained US Journalist Austin Tice In Syria: Report
content: For over a decade, the disappearance of American journalist Austin Tice remained one of the most haunting mysteries of the Syrian civil war. Tice went missing near Damascus in August 2012, days after celebrating his 31st birthday.

title: 'Ghar Ka Khana' In Orbit: Indian Flavours To Be Part Of Space Mission
content: As India prepares to send as astronaut to the International Space Station for the Axiom-4 mission, the spotlight is not only on the science and symbolism of the flight but also on the food that will accompany the country's first Gaganyatri in space.

title: As Race To Replace Space Station Heats Up, California Company Bets On Haven-1
content: VAST Space's Haven-1 integrates with the Crew Dragon spacecraft of SpaceX and is set to launch on a single Falcon 9 rocket in 2026.

title: Dutch Far-Right Leader Quits Ruling Coalition Over Migration Plan
content: Geert Wilders said his coalition partners were not willing to embrace his ideas on halting asylum migration, for which he had demanded immediate support last week.

title: Elon Musk’s father Errol Musk to visit Ram Temple in Ayodhya on June 4
content: Errol Musk, father of Elon Musk, is scheduled to visit the Ram temple in Ayodhya on June 4. He is likely to be treated as a state guest by the Uttar Pradesh government. This visit is part of his five-day trip to India, during which he will also attend business meetings.
